question: A block of certain mass is placed on a rough inclined plane. The angle between the plane and the horizontal is <katex>$30^{\circ}$</katex>. The coefficients of static and kinetic frictions between the block and the inclined plane are 0.6 and 0.5 respectively. Then the magnitude of the acceleration of the block is [Take <katex>$g=10~ms^{-2}$</katex>]
explanation: Check if the block moves: Limiting friction condition.
Component of gravity down the incline <katex>$mg \sin 30^{\circ} = 0.5 mg$</katex>.
Max static friction <katex>$\mu_s mg \cos 30^{\circ} = 0.6 \times mg \times 0.866 \approx 0.52 mg$</katex>.
Since applied force (<katex>$0.5 mg$</katex>) < max static friction (<katex>$0.52 mg$</katex>), the block does not move. Acceleration is zero.
